page.title: 17Agriculture
page.content: Farms in this area are mostly dairy farms. The breeds of cattle reared are Friesians and Ayrshires. In Summer the cattle eat grass. The farmers grow more grass to make silage and hay to feed the cattle over the Winter. Cattle are sometimes fed on cattle cake and brewers grain. A lot of slurry and expensive fertiliser is used to promote the growth of the grass. Some cattle are fattened and sold for their meat. Two examples of typical dairy farms are "Leaths" owned by the McMiken family, and "Upper Torrs", by the Smith family. Unusually, for this area, there is a farm "Meikle Knox", which specialises in breeding and rearing pigs. This farm also has a shop which sells a variety of farm produce.
